channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Shadowing in CR-Dynamical Systems
item.description: arXiv:2505.23089v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A CR-dynamical system is a pair $(X, G)$, where $X$ is a non-empty compact Hausdorff space with uniformity $\mathscr{U}$ and $G$ is a closed relation on $X$. In this paper we introduce the $(i, j)$-shadowing properties in CR-dynamical systems, which generalises the shadowing property from topological dynamical systems $(X, f)$. This extends previous work on shadowing in set-valued dynamical systems.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Wood

item.title: On generalized limits and ultrafilters
item.description: arXiv:2505.23263v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Given an ideal $\mathcal{I}$ on $\omega$, we denote by $\mathrm{SL}(\mathcal{I})$ the family of positive normalized linear functionals on $\ell_\infty$ which assign value $0$ to all characteristic sequences of sets in $\mathcal{I}$. We show that every element of $\mathrm{SL}(\mathcal{I})$ is a Choquet average of certain ultrafilter limit functionals. Also, we prove that the diameter of $\mathrm{SL}(\mathcal{I})$ is $2$ if and only if $\mathcal{I}$ is not maximal, and that the latter claim can be considerably strengthened if $\mathcal{I}$ is meager. Lastly, we provide several applications: for instance, recovering a result of Freedman in [Bull. Lond. Math. Soc. 13 (1981), 224--228], we show that the family of bounded sequences for which all functionals in $\mathrm{SL}(\mathcal{I})$ assign the same value coincides with the closed vector space of bounded $\mathcal{I}$-convergent sequences.
item.dc:creator: Paolo Leonetti, Cihan Orhan

item.title: Higher homotopy wild sets
item.description: arXiv:2505.23665v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The $\pi_n$-wild set $\mathbf{w}_{n}(X)$ of a topological space $X$ is the subspace of $X$ consisting of the points at which there exists a shrinking sequence of essential based maps $S^n\to X$. In this paper, we show that the homotopy type of $\mathbf{w}_{n}(X)$ is a homotopy invariant of $X$ and, in analogy to the known one-dimensional case, we show that for certain $n$-dimensional $\pi_n$-shape injective metric spaces, the homeomorphism type of $\mathbf{w}_{n}(X)$ is a homotopy invariant of $X$. We also prove that the $\pi_n$-wild set of a Peano continuum can be homeomorphic to any compact metric space.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Brazas, Atish Mitra
